<item>
	<title>Unconvincing Canadian men’s hockey team pulls off win against Korea </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/olympics/opinion/2018/02/18/unconvincing-canadian-mens-hockey-team-pulls-off-win-against-korea.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">6faa4825-fc5a-420d-831f-3b7c2b5362ae</guid>
	<author>Neil Davidson - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 11:08:53 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/opinion/2018/02/18/unconvincing-canadian-mens-hockey-team-pulls-off-win-against-korea/goal.jpg"/><br/>While Canada emerged victorious, the Korean team and its loyal fans had a night to remember.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/opinion/2018/02/18/unconvincing-canadian-mens-hockey-team-pulls-off-win-against-korea/goal.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Unconvincing Canadian men’s hockey team pulls off win against Korea </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/opinion/2018/02/18/unconvincing-canadian-mens-hockey-team-pulls-off-win-against-korea/goal.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Canadian forward Gilbert Brule, right, scores as Canada plays Korea on Sunday.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Steve Russell</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Canadian two-man bobsled team sits in second place after two runs </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadian-two-man-bobsled-team-sits-in-second-place-after-two-runs.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">7349ee43-48ce-4aa3-9420-6e0e97d802af</guid>
	<author>Tim Reynolds - The Associated Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 10:22:46 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadian-two-man-bobsled-team-sits-in-second-place-after-two-runs/bobsled.jpg"/><br/>Justin Kripps and Alexander Kopacz are one tenth of a second back from Germany, putting them in contention for a medal Monday night.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadian-two-man-bobsled-team-sits-in-second-place-after-two-runs/bobsled.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Canadian two-man bobsled team sits in second place after two runs </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadian-two-man-bobsled-team-sits-in-second-place-after-two-runs/bobsled.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Canadians Justin Kripps and Alexander Kopacz take a curve during the two-man bobsled competition on Sunday.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Wong Maye-E</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">The Associated Press</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Norwegian Olympic curlers taking gold for choice of pants </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/norwegian-olympic-curlers-taking-gold-for-choice-of-pants.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">02c35df6-ec0b-4cef-8f77-1eee7e3608c5</guid>
	<author>Annie Arnone - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 09:47:22 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/norwegian-olympic-curlers-taking-gold-for-choice-of-pants/pants.jpg"/><br/>The pants are so popular there’s a Facebook page dedicated to them with almost 500,000 followers.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/norwegian-olympic-curlers-taking-gold-for-choice-of-pants/pants.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Norwegian Olympic curlers taking gold for choice of pants </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/norwegian-olympic-curlers-taking-gold-for-choice-of-pants/pants.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Norway's team prepares to go on the ice for a men's curling match against Denmark. The team's trademark pants are still gaining fans even after a third Olympics.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Natacha Pisarenko</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Associated Pres</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>

<item>
	<title>Russian delegation at Olympics confirms doping case, reports say</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/amateur/2018/02/18/russian-delegation-at-olympics-confirms-doping-case-reports-say.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">ecf86225-3308-4ad9-96a0-454fef804776</guid>
	<author>Tariq Panja - The New York Times</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 08:21:28 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2018/02/18/russian-delegation-at-olympics-confirms-doping-case-reports-say/flag.jpg"/><br/>Technically, Russia was banned from the 2018 Games because of a government-sponsored doping scheme at the 2014 Sochi Olympics.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2018/02/18/russian-delegation-at-olympics-confirms-doping-case-reports-say/flag.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Russian delegation at Olympics confirms doping case, reports say</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2018/02/18/russian-delegation-at-olympics-confirms-doping-case-reports-say/flag.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Reports suggest an athlete with the Russian delegation has failed a doping test.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">FABRICE COFFRINI</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">AFP/GETTY IMAGES</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Bruce Arthur: Homan’s roller-coaster ride continues with improbable win over Swiss</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/homans-roller-coaster-ride-continues-with-improbable-win-over-swiss.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">04b9a012-408d-409b-b09f-49c8f2416b88</guid>
	<author>Bruce Arthur - Sports Columnist</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 08:03:51 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/homans-roller-coaster-ride-continues-with-improbable-win-over-swiss/homan.jpg"/><br/>Tirinzoni was 30-1 over the last four years when up two with two ends to play and sitting without the hammer, yet Canada broke through for three in the ninth, and stole one in the 10th to improve to 2-3 in round robin. Deep breaths, everyone. Maybe have a beer, Bruce Arthur writes.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/homans-roller-coaster-ride-continues-with-improbable-win-over-swiss/homan.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Bruce Arthur: Homan’s roller-coaster ride continues with improbable win over Swiss</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/homans-roller-coaster-ride-continues-with-improbable-win-over-swiss/homan.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Canadian skip Rachel Homan and her rink improved to 2-3 in the preliminary round after a wild 10-8 comeback win Sunday against Switzerland.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Paul Chiasson</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Canada’s Beaulieu-Marchand wins Olympic bronze in men’s slopestyle skiing</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadas-beaulieu-marchand-wins-bronze-in-olympic-slopestyle.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">e0e969cd-c69a-4e70-a518-3a361d468bfb</guid>
	<author>Kerry Gillespie - Sports Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 00:48:52 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadas-beaulieu-marchand-wins-bronze-in-olympic-slopestyle/marchandbronzesr.jpg"/><br/></description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadas-beaulieu-marchand-wins-bronze-in-olympic-slopestyle/marchandbronzesr.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Canada’s Beaulieu-Marchand wins Olympic bronze in men’s slopestyle skiing</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadas-beaulieu-marchand-wins-bronze-in-olympic-slopestyle/marchandbronzesr.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Alex Beaulieu-Marchand of Canada celebrates his bronze medal in the men's slopestyle ski event Sunday at the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Steve Russell</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadas-beaulieu-marchand-wins-bronze-in-olympic-slopestyle/marchandsr.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Canada’s Beaulieu-Marchand wins Olympic bronze in men’s slopestyle skiing</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadas-beaulieu-marchand-wins-bronze-in-olympic-slopestyle/marchandsr.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Beaulieu-Marchand took third place in the Olympic slopestyle ski event Sunday. The skier from Quebec City won bronze with a score of 92.40 on his second run.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Steve Russell</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadas-beaulieu-marchand-wins-bronze-in-olympic-slopestyle/beaulieu_marchand.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Canada’s Beaulieu-Marchand wins Olympic bronze in men’s slopestyle skiing</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/canadas-beaulieu-marchand-wins-bronze-in-olympic-slopestyle/beaulieu_marchand.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Alex Beaulieu-Marchand reacts to his score following his second run Sunday in the Olympic men's slopestyle ski final in Pyeongchang, South Korea.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">JONATHAN HAYWARD</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Homan comes back for 10-8 win at Games, Koe falls in early game</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/koe-drops-second-straight-game-at-olympics-after-8-6-loss-to-swiss.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">afd7c537-a8a0-4056-be0d-0f00529960c0</guid>
	<author>The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 00:35:48 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/koe-drops-second-straight-game-at-olympics-after-8-6-loss-to-swiss/koe.jpg"/><br/>The medal games will kick off Friday.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/koe-drops-second-straight-game-at-olympics-after-8-6-loss-to-swiss/koe.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Homan comes back for 10-8 win at Games, Koe falls in early game</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/18/koe-drops-second-straight-game-at-olympics-after-8-6-loss-to-swiss/koe.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Canada's skip Kevin Koe dropped his second straight game Sunday after an 8-6 loss to Switzerland.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Natacha Pisarenko</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Maybe Tyler Bozak's line is waking up </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/breakaway_blog/2018/02/17/maybe-tyler-bozak-s-line-is-waking-up-.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">9a48b1bc-948d-4448-a3c3-f14b98ebdd7f</guid>
	<author>Kevin McGran - Sports Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 23:05:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/uploads/2018/02/18/9aed2601857124177-c05ba0825a374fb9aed2601857124177-0-cpt63648447.jpg0"/><br/>Tyler Bozak and Connor Brown ended long scoring droughts in the Maple Leafs' 5-3 loss Saturday to Pittsburgh. Here are Breakaway's Takeaways on the the game</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/uploads/2018/02/18/9aed2601857124177-c05ba0825a374fb9aed2601857124177-0-cpt63648447.jpg0" medium="image">
	<media:title>Maybe Tyler Bozak's line is waking up </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/uploads/2018/02/18/9aed2601857124177-c05ba0825a374fb9aed2601857124177-0-cpt63648447.jpg0"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Tyler Bozak, left, celebrates his first-period goal with Maple Leafs teammate Mitch Marner in Saturday’s 5-3 loss to the Penguins in Pittsburgh.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Gene J. Puskar/AP Photo</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"> </media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Penguins score two in third to end Leafs’ five-game win streak</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/leafs/2018/02/17/penguins-score-two-in-third-to-end-leafs-five-game-win-streak.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">a081ab09-62b1-4cfe-9cab-00583d23972c</guid>
	<author>Kevin McGran - Sports Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 22:17:24 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/leafs/2018/02/17/penguins-score-two-in-third-to-end-leafs-five-game-win-streak/kessel.jpg"/><br/>Pittsburgh extends its run at home to 11 games.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/leafs/2018/02/17/penguins-score-two-in-third-to-end-leafs-five-game-win-streak/kessel.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Penguins score two in third to end Leafs’ five-game win streak</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/leafs/2018/02/17/penguins-score-two-in-third-to-end-leafs-five-game-win-streak/kessel.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The Leafs shut down former teammate Phil Kessel, right, on Saturday, but the Penguins still extended their home winning streak to 11 games.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Gene J. Puskar</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">The Associated Press</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>

<item>
	<title>DeMar DeRozan’s tweet stirs social media support</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/raptors/2018/02/17/innocuous-demar-derozan-tweet-stirs-social-media-support.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">b046d50c-368b-4515-80b9-6851fcf3d9d7</guid>
	<author>Doug Smith - Sports Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 19:09:33 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2018/02/17/innocuous-demar-derozan-tweet-stirs-social-media-support/demar.jpg"/><br/>What turned out to be an innocuous seven-word tweet from DeRozan sparked a maelstrom for a few hours and spoke volumes about his connection with fans in Toronto and across Canada.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2018/02/17/innocuous-demar-derozan-tweet-stirs-social-media-support/demar.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>DeMar DeRozan’s tweet stirs social media support</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/raptors/2018/02/17/innocuous-demar-derozan-tweet-stirs-social-media-support/demar.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>A simple, single tweet by DeMar DeRozan created a stir on social media, highlighting the power a star athlete's words can have.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Mark Blinch</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Canada could be headed for record medal total in Pyeongchang</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/olympics/2018/02/17/canada-could-be-headed-for-record-medal-total-in-pyeongchang.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">8ce87f5e-17af-4017-9f15-f4803ab2ee58</guid>
	<author>Donna Spencer - The Canadian Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 19:09:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/17/canada-could-be-headed-for-record-medal-total-in-pyeongchang/tedjan.jpg"/><br/>But catching Norway at the top of the standings might be a challenge.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/17/canada-could-be-headed-for-record-medal-total-in-pyeongchang/tedjan.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Canada could be headed for record medal total in Pyeongchang</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/17/canada-could-be-headed-for-record-medal-total-in-pyeongchang/tedjan.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Canadians are inspiring each other with their performances in Pyeongchang. Luger Sam Edney said the speedskating gold medal by Ted-Jan Bloemen, pictured, "gives me goose bumps right now."</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Steve Russell</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Canada’s Steve Nash among finalists for Basketball Hall of Fame</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/basketball/2018/02/17/canadas-steve-nash-among-finalists-for-basketball-hall-of-fame.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">fa23e63a-5118-4a6d-85ef-9fe411f7df29</guid>
	<author>Doug Smith - Sports Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 18:17:46 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/basketball/2018/02/17/canadas-steve-nash-among-finalists-for-basketball-hall-of-fame/nash.jpg"/><br/>Nash joins eight others for possible induction into the Springfield, Mass., shrine from the North American category.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/basketball/2018/02/17/canadas-steve-nash-among-finalists-for-basketball-hall-of-fame/nash.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Canada’s Steve Nash among finalists for Basketball Hall of Fame</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/basketball/2018/02/17/canadas-steve-nash-among-finalists-for-basketball-hall-of-fame/nash.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Steve Nash will get a chance to become Canada’s first Hall of Fame entrant when the final induction list is released in April.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Rocky Widner</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">NBAE via Getty Images</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Southampton bounces West Bromwich Albion from FA Cup </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/soccer/2018/02/17/southampton-bounces-west-bromwich-albion-from-fa-cup.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">f219e44d-023d-4544-bdce-b531c8b7fc78</guid>
	<author>Tony Jimenez - The Associated Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 18:01:47 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/soccer/2018/02/17/southampton-bounces-west-bromwich-albion-from-fa-cup/brighton.jpg"/><br/>The Baggies sacked two executives this week, had four players face a theft rap in Spain and were ousted from the FA Cup by Southhampton</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/soccer/2018/02/17/southampton-bounces-west-bromwich-albion-from-fa-cup/brighton.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Southampton bounces West Bromwich Albion from FA Cup </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/soccer/2018/02/17/southampton-bounces-west-bromwich-albion-from-fa-cup/brighton.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Brighton striker Jurgen Locadia provided an early return on his $19.6-million (U.S.) signing by scoring the icebreaker during a 3-1 win against Coventry in the FA Cup fifth round on Saturday. The win put Brighton into the quarter-finals.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">GLYN KIRK</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">AFP/GETTY IMAGES</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>At Olympics, Russians are fans without a country </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/amateur/2018/02/17/at-olympics-russians-are-fans-without-a-country.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">0775451a-ba80-4137-947c-fb5be8788a12</guid>
	<author>Chip Scoggins - Star Tribune</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 17:48:35 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2018/02/17/at-olympics-russians-are-fans-without-a-country/russfan.jpg"/><br/>Technically, Russia isn’t here after being banned by the International Olympic Committee as punishment for a government-sponsored doping scheme at the 2014 Sochi Olympics.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2018/02/17/at-olympics-russians-are-fans-without-a-country/russfan.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>At Olympics, Russians are fans without a country </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2018/02/17/at-olympics-russians-are-fans-without-a-country/russfan.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Russian fans cheer on Olympic Athletes from Russia during a men's preliminary  ice hockey game against the United States, Saturday at the Winter Olympic Games.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">ED JONES</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">AFP/GETTY IMAGES</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Russians earn bye, while Kovalchuk sneaks in parting shot for media</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/amateur/2018/02/17/russians-earn-bye-while-kovalchuk-sneaks-in-parting-shot-for-media.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">7a72c5fb-c149-46d2-ae2b-063a8c112595</guid>
	<author>Stephen Whyno - The Associated Press</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 17:38:23 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2018/02/17/russians-earn-bye-while-kovalchuk-sneaks-in-parting-shot-for-media/kovalchuk_web.jpg"/><br/>After scoring two goals in Olympic Athletes From Russia’s 4-0 win, Ilya Kovalchuk devilishly delighted in thrashing the U.S. media for frequently replaying T.J. Oshie’s bravura shootout performance four years ago in Sochi.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2018/02/17/russians-earn-bye-while-kovalchuk-sneaks-in-parting-shot-for-media/kovalchuk_web.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Russians earn bye, while Kovalchuk sneaks in parting shot for media</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/amateur/2018/02/17/russians-earn-bye-while-kovalchuk-sneaks-in-parting-shot-for-media/kovalchuk_web.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Goalie Vasili Koshechkin, left, Ilya Kovalchuk nd Sergei Shirokov celebrate the Olympic Athletes from Russia's 4-0 win against the United States in Olympic men's hockey on Saturday. The win sent OAR directly to a quarter-final game on Wednesday.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Bruce Bennett</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">GETTY IMAGES</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>

	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 17:34:15 EST</pubDate>

<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/baseball/2018/02/16/healthy-stronger-russell-martin-key-to-blue-jays-2018-fortunes/martin.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Richard Griffin: Healthy, stronger Russell Martin key to Blue Jays’ 2018 fortunes</media:title>

	<media:description>Jays catcher Russell Martin said he's coming into camp stronger than he was at this point last year.</media:description>

	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>

<item>
	<title>Dave Feschuk: Drake puts spotlight on Canadian hockey player Sarah Nurse</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/sports/olympics/2018/02/17/drake-puts-spotlight-on-canadian-hockey-player-sarah-nurse.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">bb66ba49-420a-48db-a4dc-03efe850bae9</guid>
	<author>Dave Feschuk - Sports Columnist</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 17:09:27 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/17/drake-puts-spotlight-on-canadian-hockey-player-sarah-nurse/sarah.jpg"/><br/>Drake, the chart-topping musician and Toronto-based sports fan, posted an Instagram story that paid flirty tribute to the Canadian winger, competing at the Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/17/drake-puts-spotlight-on-canadian-hockey-player-sarah-nurse/sarah.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Dave Feschuk: Drake puts spotlight on Canadian hockey player Sarah Nurse</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/sports/olympics/2018/02/17/drake-puts-spotlight-on-canadian-hockey-player-sarah-nurse/sarah.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Team Canada's Sarah Nurse, who had about 5,000 Instagram followers as of Saturday afternoon, said she’d gained bout 2,000 since being the focus of Drake's Instagram post.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE CANADIAN PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
</channel></rss>
